paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the KCNH2 gene variants, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.phenotype: prolonged action potential duration, resistance to atrial fibrillation

individual_records.phenotype_details: demonstrated prolonged action potential duration and resistance to AF
individual_records.evidence_sentence: By interrupting the alpha subunit of the IKr channel in the gene-treated pigs, the investigators found an increase in the APD, resistance to burst pacing-induced AF, and increased conversion from AF to sinus rhythm.

individual_records.phenotype_details: delayed or prevented development of persistent AF
individual_records.evidence_sentence: They found that pigs who received gene therapy had markedly longer APD and that the development of persistent AF was delayed or prevented in a rapid atrial pacing model.

functional_data.summary: Gene therapy targeting KCNH2 resulted in prolonged action potential duration and resistance to atrial fibrillation.

variants.segregation_data: segregates with disease in experimental models
variants.additional_notes: The studies were conducted in pigs, and the effects were reversible at two weeks.
key_quotes: These effects were reversed at two weeks, which correlated with a loss of gene expression.
Notably, however, both studies were of too short a duration to determine the long-term side effects of atrial IKr suppression.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding KCNH2 variants were extracted from the main text.
